description: Whether using for personal email or work email as large business organization, this course covers everything one needs to become a skilled and informed user of Microsoft Outlook on the Web. This course is specifically for using Outlook through a web browser with either a paid subscription to Office 365 or a free mail account with Outlook.com.   Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks.

This course is specifically for using Outlook through a web browser with either a paid subscription to Office 365 or a free mail account with Outlook.com.   Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks.
name: Outlook on the Web
subtitle: Personal information management application

episodes.description: Whether using for personal email or work email as large business organization, this course covers everything one needs to become a skilled and informed user of Microsoft Outlook on the Web. This course is specifically for using Outlook through a web browser with either a paid subscription to Office 365 or a free mail account with Outlook.com. Our hosts start with explaining the basic terminology and setup of email accounts and continue on to all areas of Outlook including managing email, contacts, calendars, and tasks.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.932
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.932 --> 00:00:07.735
Hello, welcome to OfficeProTV.

3
00:00:07.735 --> 00:00:11.834
I'm Von Smith and
in this course overview we're gonna

4
00:00:11.834 --> 00:00:16.746
be discussing the topics in this
show which is Outlook on the Web.

5
00:00:16.746 --> 00:00:20.348
We're also gonna talk about
who is this show targeted for,

6
00:00:20.348 --> 00:00:22.490
what is our target audience?

7
00:00:22.490 --> 00:00:24.392
What should you know
before you get started?

8
00:00:24.392 --> 00:00:27.880
And any extra tidbits to
help you along the way.

9
00:00:27.880 --> 00:00:29.444
So why don't we go ahead and

10
00:00:29.444 --> 00:00:33.398
talk about the topics that we are going
to be covering in this series.

11
00:00:33.398 --> 00:00:36.089
We're gonna start off with,
well, an introduction.

12
00:00:36.089 --> 00:00:38.590
Gonna be going over some terminology.

13
00:00:38.590 --> 00:00:41.533
What is an email server,
what is a pop, and what's an iMap?

14
00:00:41.533 --> 00:00:45.232
And all of different things that you
might be hearing when people talk

15
00:00:45.232 --> 00:00:46.198
about emailing.

16
00:00:46.198 --> 00:00:48.736
And especially some of those
IT professionals that you

17
00:00:48.736 --> 00:00:50.820
might be working with in your help desk.

18
00:00:50.820 --> 00:00:55.064
So just gets you a little bit more
familiar with the area of emailing,

19
00:00:55.064 --> 00:00:59.835
an exchange servers, and Office 365 and
free accounts in Outlook.com.

20
00:00:59.835 --> 00:01:04.763
So we're also gonna be talking about
the interface of your mail in your

21
00:01:04.763 --> 00:01:07.890
browser because this is out on the web.

22
00:01:07.890 --> 00:01:10.070
So we will be taking
some time to go ahead and

23
00:01:10.070 --> 00:01:13.779
compare and contrast between having
the Outlook in your web interface.

24
00:01:13.779 --> 00:01:20.090
And then also your local ones with this
show is targeted to Outlook on the web.

25
00:01:20.090 --> 00:01:23.177
I will also gonna go ahead and talk about
your account set-up which honestly,

26
00:01:23.177 --> 00:01:26.187
they're really isn't much set-up to
do because you're already online.

27
00:01:26.187 --> 00:01:28.290
And so, that's kinda of the nice thing.

28
00:01:28.290 --> 00:01:30.780
We're also going to talk about
some emailing, all right.

29
00:01:30.780 --> 00:01:34.598
That's probably a lot with Outlook is
known for so we're going to send and

30
00:01:34.598 --> 00:01:35.740
receive emails.

31
00:01:35.740 --> 00:01:37.652
We're also gonna be
formatting our messages.

32
00:01:37.652 --> 00:01:42.293
We're gonna go over how to organize and
customize your Outlook environment and

33
00:01:42.293 --> 00:01:45.488
how to be best effective and
efficient for your needs.

34
00:01:45.488 --> 00:01:48.170
We'll also talk about, ooh,
good old junk mail, right.

35
00:01:48.170 --> 00:01:49.436
That can always be a pain in our sides.

36
00:01:49.436 --> 00:01:51.761
We'll hopefully we'll try
to alleviate that and

37
00:01:51.761 --> 00:01:55.930
be able to show you all the different
options you have through junk mail.

38
00:01:55.930 --> 00:01:58.767
And we'll go over rules and
automation that can be really,

39
00:01:58.767 --> 00:02:00.708
really handy to making more efficient.

40
00:02:00.708 --> 00:02:02.470
We're also gonna talk about people.

41
00:02:02.470 --> 00:02:05.130
Now if you're from back in the day,
what are people?

42
00:02:05.130 --> 00:02:07.598
It's your contacts,
they're really the same thing.

43
00:02:07.598 --> 00:02:11.640
We'll be creating new contacts,
we'll be editing contacts.

44
00:02:11.640 --> 00:02:15.174
And all the different things that you
can do within that particular area of

45
00:02:15.174 --> 00:02:16.145
Outlook on the web.

46
00:02:16.145 --> 00:02:20.220
And doing some comparing and
contrasting in that area, specifically,

47
00:02:20.220 --> 00:02:24.898
because there are some decent amount of
difference between the local installation

48
00:02:24.898 --> 00:02:28.129
the online version that you
have in Outlook, on the web.

49
00:02:28.129 --> 00:02:30.910
We'll also talk about
our wonderful calendar.

50
00:02:30.910 --> 00:02:34.303
Keeping ourselves organized by creating
appointments, creating meetings.

51
00:02:34.303 --> 00:02:38.491
And then also being able to share
calendars within your organization.

52
00:02:38.491 --> 00:02:43.920
Also outside of your organization
by going ahead and publishing it.

53
00:02:43.920 --> 00:02:45.480
And then we have our other topic,

54
00:02:45.480 --> 00:02:47.995
that's where we're going
to talk about some tasks.

55
00:02:47.995 --> 00:02:50.852
And what you have on local installation
which are known as notes and

56
00:02:50.852 --> 00:02:52.650
where they are on the outlook for the web.

57
00:02:52.650 --> 00:02:57.243
And any other miscellaneous items
that we would like to go ahead and

58
00:02:57.243 --> 00:03:00.943
include we'll go ahead and
put it in that other area.

59
00:03:00.943 --> 00:03:02.930
Now who was this for?

60
00:03:02.930 --> 00:03:04.686
It's all Office users.

61
00:03:04.686 --> 00:03:09.403
This is Office with a capital O
mean that you are using Office,

62
00:03:09.403 --> 00:03:11.560
the suite of application.

63
00:03:11.560 --> 00:03:15.218
You have either an Outlook, or
sorry an Office 365 subscription,

64
00:03:15.218 --> 00:03:19.128
you have an account that you have paid
for, and have a paid version of that.

65
00:03:19.128 --> 00:03:26.240
But this show also covers the outlook.com,
your free version of using Outlook.

66
00:03:26.240 --> 00:03:29.359
So that's why we have Office,
it doesn't mean, Office with a capital.

67
00:03:29.359 --> 00:03:33.072
It does not mean you have to
be In an office environment or

68
00:03:33.072 --> 00:03:38.760
in a large organization, you can be in
an organization of two, one, or 20000.

69
00:03:38.760 --> 00:03:44.160
So it doesn't matter what size of
the office that you physically obtain or

70
00:03:44.160 --> 00:03:47.570
where you actually work from and
use Outlook.

71
00:03:47.570 --> 00:03:51.350
But you can see that I do
have using Outlook online.

72
00:03:51.350 --> 00:03:54.359
So this is where your gonna be
using the web interface and

73
00:03:54.359 --> 00:03:55.966
not the local installation.

74
00:03:55.966 --> 00:03:58.314
If you have access to it, that's great but

75
00:03:58.314 --> 00:04:02.434
I do take it from the standpoint that
you're only gonna be using it online.

76
00:04:02.434 --> 00:04:04.367
And yes I will compare and contrast but

77
00:04:04.367 --> 00:04:07.520
that's why we have this entire
series where out gone the web.

78
00:04:07.520 --> 00:04:12.495
And this is for a basic user, I would
say taking from like some basic skills

79
00:04:12.495 --> 00:04:17.550
up into an intermediate level of
using this particular product.

80
00:04:17.550 --> 00:04:19.664
Now what do you need to
know before we get started?

81
00:04:19.664 --> 00:04:24.244
Having some Windows basics with your
operating system is going to always be

82
00:04:24.244 --> 00:04:24.760
handy.

83
00:04:24.760 --> 00:04:27.205
So know where your start menu,
you know where your browsers,

84
00:04:27.205 --> 00:04:29.240
do you know what browser
you're going to be using.

85
00:04:29.240 --> 00:04:32.083
Are you using Chrome,
are you using Firefox?

86
00:04:32.083 --> 00:04:33.040
Are using Edge?

87
00:04:33.040 --> 00:04:36.797
And I actually kinda cover quite
a few of them, kinda jump back and

88
00:04:36.797 --> 00:04:41.388
forth in between them with the different
users within this particular series.

89
00:04:41.388 --> 00:04:44.640
We're gonna be using our good
old Justin and Joey and Lance.

90
00:04:44.640 --> 00:04:47.194
If you haven't watched any of
my other series, well get ready,

91
00:04:47.194 --> 00:04:48.150
they are coming at you.

92
00:04:48.150 --> 00:04:50.620
And so that's where we're
going to be using those.

93
00:04:50.620 --> 00:04:54.085
So having some familiarity
with some other Office

94
00:04:54.085 --> 00:04:58.710
products is always a helpful leg up for
you but it's not required.

95
00:04:58.710 --> 00:05:01.068
If you've used Excel before,
or you have Word,

96
00:05:01.068 --> 00:05:04.070
you know a little bit about
Office products, that's great.

97
00:05:04.070 --> 00:05:08.044
Or maybe you've been using Google, or
you've been using Yahoo for your mail and

98
00:05:08.044 --> 00:05:10.682
now you're kind of familiar
with those interfaces.

99
00:05:10.682 --> 00:05:14.953
That might go ahead and give you a little
bit of something to start with when you

100
00:05:14.953 --> 00:05:16.680
start using Outlook on Web.

101
00:05:16.680 --> 00:05:18.118
But again, not required.

102
00:05:18.118 --> 00:05:20.260
I start from the very beginning and go on.

103
00:05:21.720 --> 00:05:25.825
Extra things to always keep in mind,
there are always other options.

104
00:05:25.825 --> 00:05:30.327
Maybe not as many of them on-line
because of course this is a,

105
00:05:30.327 --> 00:05:36.730
I would call almost like a slimmed down
version of what is capable within Outlook.

106
00:05:36.730 --> 00:05:38.535
Because it is on the web and

107
00:05:38.535 --> 00:05:42.322
you are limited to how
the browser is going to respond.

108
00:05:42.322 --> 00:05:45.475
So sometimes right clicking
is not always going to work

109
00:05:45.475 --> 00:05:48.980
in your low section of products,
that's always an option.

110
00:05:48.980 --> 00:05:51.165
There's usually like six or
seven ways to do something.

111
00:05:51.165 --> 00:05:53.960
Maybe here you might only have two or
three.

112
00:05:53.960 --> 00:05:57.676
So do keep that in mind, but
there could always be other ways of

113
00:05:57.676 --> 00:06:02.550
getting to perform different tasks, that
I'm showing you the way I go about it.

114
00:06:02.550 --> 00:06:05.530
You might have some other ways
that you might be able to do it.

115
00:06:05.530 --> 00:06:08.730
And I did throw in here the browsers.

116
00:06:08.730 --> 00:06:13.372
While there might not be too many
options it could make a difference of

117
00:06:13.372 --> 00:06:17.309
whether you're using Outlook
through the Edge browser.

118
00:06:17.309 --> 00:06:22.304
A Microsoft product, versus let's
say Chrome, or even if you're on

119
00:06:22.304 --> 00:06:27.234
a Mac with a Safari browser,
that could Have something to do with it.

120
00:06:27.234 --> 00:06:28.887
If you do any type of searching, and

121
00:06:28.887 --> 00:06:31.840
you can see that's one of my
bullet points right there.

122
00:06:31.840 --> 00:06:35.465
Searching for the answers, there's
always something that's gonna come up or

123
00:06:35.465 --> 00:06:36.774
like, why is it doing that?

124
00:06:36.774 --> 00:06:38.930
You go out and you search for the web.

125
00:06:38.930 --> 00:06:41.394
And a lot of those forums that
come from the Microsoft Help,

126
00:06:41.394 --> 00:06:43.278
they'll be like what
browser are you using?

127
00:06:43.278 --> 00:06:47.856
They're always gonna ask the people who
are asking questions in those forums,

128
00:06:47.856 --> 00:06:51.970
tell me what browser you're using
because it could make a difference.

129
00:06:51.970 --> 00:06:55.691
Maybe there are certain features that
are not available within that particular

130
00:06:55.691 --> 00:06:57.757
version of the browser that you're using.

131
00:06:57.757 --> 00:07:02.190
And another one that's always happening,
updates.

132
00:07:02.190 --> 00:07:04.404
Updates can throw things
all out of whack sometimes.

133
00:07:04.404 --> 00:07:08.372
That's actually happened to me right in
the middle of one of my episodes where

134
00:07:08.372 --> 00:07:12.291
there's an Office update and
it's completely reconfigured everything.

135
00:07:12.291 --> 00:07:15.000
So it could happen, it will happen.

136
00:07:15.000 --> 00:07:19.372
And it might have some changes in what
you're looking at at the time that you're

137
00:07:19.372 --> 00:07:22.720
watching this as opposed to
the time that I did the tutorial.

138
00:07:22.720 --> 00:07:27.283
And of course anytime we had any major
changes, we will always go ahead and

139
00:07:27.283 --> 00:07:29.720
update those episodes for you.

140
00:07:29.720 --> 00:07:32.695
And of course everybody has a different
reason for using Outlook, and

141
00:07:32.695 --> 00:07:35.230
you might not use it the same
way that somebody else uses it.

142
00:07:35.230 --> 00:07:37.887
But that's okay to eat its own,
and so I wanna try and

143
00:07:37.887 --> 00:07:40.020
give you all the different options.

144
00:07:40.020 --> 00:07:43.694
So just keep that in mind, like I don't
wanna use that feature, then don't,

145
00:07:43.694 --> 00:07:45.710
it's okay, you use it to your advantage.

146
00:07:45.710 --> 00:07:49.286
But the most part, but the most
important thing, try to have fun, or

147
00:07:49.286 --> 00:07:50.960
at least watch these episodes.

148
00:07:50.960 --> 00:07:54.064
We try to keep it light, and
have some playing around and

149
00:07:54.064 --> 00:07:57.710
making some jokes here and
there to try to keep your learning fun.

150
00:07:57.710 --> 00:07:59.138
Because I will tell you,

151
00:07:59.138 --> 00:08:02.950
I get just as frustrated sometimes
when something doesn't work.

152
00:08:02.950 --> 00:08:05.880
And so that's where you have to kinda
sit back and just kinda take a breath.

153
00:08:05.880 --> 00:08:10.107
And make sure that you always say,
this will figure it's self out,

154
00:08:10.107 --> 00:08:14.350
I will learn how to do this, and
just have fun with everything.

155
00:08:14.350 --> 00:08:16.679
And I hope to see you in some
episodes really, really soon.

156
00:08:16.679 --> 00:08:23.306
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the differences among many of the products that are branded with the Outlook name.  Additionally, they discuss transformations that many Microsoft products have went through as they were absorbed into Outlook. Lastly, they clarify that this series will cover Outlook on the Web.
episodes.title: Introduction to Outlook on the Web

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss fundamental terminology that many should know before using Outlook.
episodes.title: Email Terminology

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss how to set up email accounts in Outlook on the web.
episodes.title: Setup Email Account

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss and explore the Outlook web interface.
episodes.title: Outlook on the Web Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the mail interface portion of Outlook. Specifically, they identify folders, peruse default views, and tweak a few settings.
episodes.title: Mail Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the basics of emailing. Specifically in this episode, creating and receiving email with a single recipient and how to attach files.
episodes.title: Mail Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the basics of emailing. Specifically in this episode, Vonne demonstrates the usage of the CC field, the BCC field, using the drafts, and forwarding messages.
episodes.title: Mail Basics Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the basics of emailing. Specifically in this episode, what to do when email is undeliverable, advanced attachment options, managing received email resources, and what is in the trash bin.
episodes.title: Mail Basics Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore and demonstrate formatting message with a focus on character and paragraph level formats.
episodes.title: Format Message Body

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne dive back into message formatting concentrating on inserting hyperlinks, images, and tables.
episodes.title: Format Message Body Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne discuss and exhibit copying and pasting from a variety of sources.
episodes.title: Format Message Body Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at a few advanced mail features in Outlook on the Web. Specific topics covered here includes: Importance, Sensitivity, Delivery Receipt, Read Receipt, Options not available in Office 365, and Options not available in Outlook.com.
episodes.title: Advanced Mail Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at a few advanced mail features in Outlook on the Web. Specific topics covered here includes: Importance icon, Read Receipt, Email Expiration, Voting, Mentions, and Undo Send.
episodes.title: Advanced Mail Features Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne take a look at using Signatures in Outlook on the Web. Specific topics covered here includes: What is a Signature, Signatures in Outlook 2016 vs. Web App, Creating Signatures, Formatting, and Inserting Images.
episodes.title: Signatures

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the litany of ways in which you can organize, customize, and search in Outlook on the Web. Here they start with organization methods like focused inbox, using Filter, marking mail as "unread", selecting messages, flagging messages, pinning messages, and settings categories.
episodes.title: Organize, Customize and Search

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the litany of ways in which you can organize, customize, and search in Outlook on the Web. Here they start with customization methods like creating custom folders, reading pane settings, message list vs. conversations, read receipts, reply settings, attachment options, and mail layout.
episodes.title: Organize, Customize and Search Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne talk about Junk Mail. Here they define and describe what gets classified as Junk by the Junk Filter. They then show you how to block or allow items explicitly, look at client and admin level Control, marking messages as Junk, syncing with local versions of Outlook, and phishing.
episodes.title: Junk Mail

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore Rules and Automation in Web-based Outlook. Here you will see how to create custom rules, use the Sweep feature, set Out-of-Office replies, and the Clutter feature.
episodes.title: Rules and Automation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explain Archiving and using the Archive folder in Web-based Outlook. They start by explaining what the Archive folder is, then they move on to Retention Policies, using Sweep, and general guidelines for archiving old messages.
episodes.title: Archive Messages

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore how to share mailboxes between mailboxes with Outlook on the Web.
episodes.title: Share and Manage Multiple Mailboxes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne navigate and identify elements of the People interface. Here they discuss topics like personal contacts, groups, lists, and contacts in a Windows Directory.
episodes.title: People Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to create and edit contacts. They also cover contact lists, deleting contacts, and import and export options.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Contacts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the Calendar interface for Outlook on the Web. They show different views, identify events, look at event details, and change calendar settings. They also cover adding birthday and other interesting calendars as well as all the options in the calendar settings.
episodes.title: Calendar Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore creating and managing appointments.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Appointments

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore creating and managing meetings.
episodes.title: Create and Manage Meetings

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore sharing calendars with others, in particular, adding secondary calendars, importing ICS files, as well as published HTML calendars from others. They also explore export and publish their own calendars.
episodes.title: Share Calendars

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne continue sharing calendars with other, in particular, giving permission to another user to manage their calendar.
episodes.title: Share Calendars Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explain tasks and how to use them effectively. They explain the different types of tasks, creating and editing tasks, and organizing tasks with sort and filter options. They also cover how notes work in Outlook on the Web.
episodes.title: Tasks and Notes

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne create explore the benefits of using groups in a team environment.
episodes.title: Groups
